The expert: s verdict also highlights the discrepancy in the number of child gun deaths mentioned in the claim. The estimate of 7,000 child gun deaths traces back to a study by Pediatrics, which found that 1,300 children die from gunshot wounds every year. This aspect raises questions about the accuracy of the claim's figure.
The New York Times analysis: mentioned in the expert's verdict, provides another aspect to verify the claim. According to their data from the Gun Violence Archive, only 138 people, including school personnel, have been killed in school shootings since Sandy Hook. This aspect challenges the claim's assertion that 7,182 students were killed in U.S. schools since 2012.
